dict.string: This was an app I made for Pernod Ricard to promote their Ballantine's brand. It was made for marketing purposes and is thus not present in the App Store. The user took a photo of a person through the app, usually at specific events, and the app filtered it to appear cartoonish - these photos were then presented on Facebook.

I made this app for Hiša Eksperimentov, a science center in Slovenia, and it was part-financed by the EU's regional development fund. It allows the user to perform hands-on experiments on experiments physically located in Hiša Eksperimentov from the comfort of their home through remote access.

With the release of Nail Designs my development career started to get serious. It is my most succesfull app up to date and is still going strong - at one time it ranked in the top 5 lifestyle apps in 20 countries and has gathered over 700.000 downloads so far. It features manicure tutorials that anyone can make at home.

Ever growing Nail Designs' user base has convinced me to continue in its niche so I released a new sister app to Nail Designs last year called Makeup Designs. It consists of makeup tutorials and is similar in design to Nail Designs.

As Nail Designs' and Makeup Designs' download numbers were still growing, I decided to expand my number of beauty apps and create a brand, under which I would release my lifestyle apps - I called it Beauty Center Apps. Hair Designs was the third addition to Beauty Center and it features hair design tutorials.

This app is the latest addition to my collection of Beauty Center Apps and it features tutorials on how to design your own jewelry - from bracelets to earrings and even some shirts. It gathered much praise since its release and has received quite a few good reviews.

Pocket Pal was my first try at an entertainment app and was actually featured by Apple in the New and Noteworthy section. It's a nice little app to have you busy for 5 minutes when you have nothing to do. Sadly, I now consider it a failure for not reaching my expectations.

I first made this app for my girlfriend's birthday. By seeing her positive reaction, I thought it would be a great app for other couples out there, so I modified the code and released it a couple of days later. It's a really simple app that animates love phrases of your choosing.

Makeup Magic is the first app I ever made - with a half a year of learning how to programme behind me and no design skill whatsoever. It's not an app that excels (understandingly, given my experience at the time) but it marks the start of my iOS developing career and that must count for something!
